channel.title: [PI]Handling Dropsystem
channel.description: Ok so my server right now handles drops through a .cfg file, I'd like to change tho the .tsm way. (Waaay less bugs) I have no idea how to do it, can anybody put me in the right direction? Thanks in advance.

item.title: [PI]Handling Dropsystem
item.dc:creator: @dwarfs222 dwarfs222
item.description:
@dwarfs222 wrote:

Thanks for the help.
I did what sk8r said, and it worked.
The .tsm is terrible indeed, but it’s better then .cfg

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Handling Dropsystem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The .TSM system is terrible. So is the .cfg system… You should really consider a different one entirely.

Here is a better one, but it may be hard to understand and implement at first: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=663319.0

I can’t find a tutorial for the .TSM system, probably because it was built into Project Insanity from the start, but this looks like it’s the most of it:
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/help/515257-npcdrops.html#post4211286

I’d say download one of the earlier PI servers or one that’s had minor changes done to it, and just rip the system from there.

Read full topic

It seems to be just a normal text file with a different extension. If you want to learn how to use those, look up BufferedReader (unless someone else recommends something else for this, but this is generally what i find for text files)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Handling Dropsystem
item.dc:creator: @dwarfs222 dwarfs222
item.description:
@dwarfs222 wrote:

No, some PI servers handle their drops in/data through a .cfg file, some PI’s handle it in their normal config file, other do it through a .tsm file.
If you have a PI server on your pc, go to /data/cfg and you’ll (hopefully) see NpcConstants.tsm.
I don’t know how Sanity did it back in the day, but I’d also like to add it to my server.
I know I sound a bit blurry, but idk how to explain it otherwise.
Maybe there are other/better ways to handle drops, if you know any you can tell me.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:

What is a .tsm file? Is it any different than any text file?

edit: (curious, and might be able to help you)
